subject: Attention,
body:
Attention,
This is for you foreign beneficiaries who may have tried by every other means to
receive your funds from Nigeria either by telegraphic transfer,atm card etc originating from the country or elsewhere but failed in the past,now i am coming in as an insider from the finance ministry, there is an authentic opportunity been giving to you all delayed beneficiaries in regards to claim of part payment of your funds through an authentic means with our crude oil sales reserves,whereby you will be required to go and receive your own funds by cash or through telephone banking directly by you the
recipient to avoid any other stories on your funds release alongside
others,these measures are taken as a result of too many complaints from numerous beneficiaries complaining that they are unable to receive their long
overdue funds after so many attempts for some time now.
You will be required to furnish us with your current details including
your recieving bank ,
any of your i.d or international passport infos inclusive
.
awaiting your immediate response for more information
best regards
dr.fred donald

subject: Re: Attention,
body:
Hello Donald,

Thank you for reaching out and providing this information. It's quite interesting to hear about the situation with funds in Nigeria. I must admit, I'm not entirely familiar with the process you're describing.

Could you please elaborate more on how this system works? How does the crude oil sales tie into the release of these funds? And what measures are being taken due to complaints?

I'm also curious about why my bank details or passport information would be needed. Could you explain that a bit more?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Florence

body:
